revised_title: Cephalosporanic Acids: A New Look at Reactions at the C-3 Position
tldr: This article discusses the chemical modification of cephalosporin C at the C-3 position, leading to the development of new cephalosporin antibiotics with enhanced therapeutic value. The authors review the chemistry behind nucleophilic displacement of the C-3'-acetoxy group and describe the reaction mechanisms, including the SN1 mechanism. The study focuses on the use of sulfur nucleophiles, which have shown to produce compounds with expanded antibiotic activity.
